page.title: 13TOURISM SAILING CLUBS
page.content: {ROYAL SOLENT YACHT CLUB This club was built on a site adjacent to the pier and overlooking the Solent in 1878. It received the Royal Charter in 1902.Currently it has 1020 members. Racing is provided for sailing cruisers in handicapped classes and 21 foot X boats and West WIght Scows. The X Class is 65 years old and the West Wight Scow Class is 60 next year. {YARMOUTH SAILING CLUB.} This club was founded in 1969. It's current premises are in the old Toll Bridge House adjacent to the old bridge. With the building of the new bridge this year the club will build a new clubhouse south of the bridge. There are just over 500 members. Racing is provided for West Wight Scows and a fleet of handicapped dinghies.
